Issues.Title: Update TextBox.cs
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1110 
Fixes #1168
Fixes #1109

## Proposed changes

- PlaceholderText default value to ""
- Make PlaceholderText virtual to keep it consistent with the other properties (#1110)
- PlaceholderText is not used by accessibility (#1168)
- Use TextLength instead Text property when drawing PlaceholderText (#1109)


### Before

- PlaceholderText default value was null which was different from Text default value.
- PlaceholderText was not virtual.
- Text property was used in WM_PAINT which breaks VMWare infrastructure client.
- Text was set when AccessibilityObject is created even when no Text or PlaceholderText was set.

### After

- PlaceholderText default value is "" to be consistent with Text default value.
- PlaceholderText is virtual.
- In WM_PAINT TextLength so Text property is not accessed.
- AccessibilityObject no longer set Text to the PlaceholderText.


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual testing: 

1. Used the On Screen keyboard to verify TextChanged event is not fired 
2. Verified manually that Text getter property is not called when WM_PAINT is called.


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.0.100-preview8-013008
 Commit:    6db6a68871

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.17763
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview8-013008\

/cc @merriemcgaw, @weltkante, @madewokherd, @IGMikeS, @M-Lipin, @stefanov-stefan
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update TextBox.cs" (#1391)

Issues.Body: Prefer using `internal set` rather than `XInternal` properties

Issues.Title: Cut back allocations on blank form startup
Issues.Body:
Key changes are removing AppDomain related logic in NativeWindow and removing HandleCollector (which is also being removed from System.Drawing).

AppDomains aren't supported on Core and GDI handle limits are many times larger than they were on Windows 95 / NT 4, and they are shared (all GDI handles come from one pool).

- Turn LOGBRUSH to struct
- Remove some duplicate P/Invokes
- Remove some dead defines
- Remove POINT class (POINT == System.Drawing.Point)
- Remove SIZE class (SIZE == System.Drawing.Size)
- Clean usings for changed files

Along with the following CoreFX changes this takes starting up a blank Form from ~5000 allocations to ~1300.

https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/39275
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/39468
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/39312

There are a number of other classes in interop that should be structs. There also seems to be some overlap with System.Drawing that might be able to be exploited (understandably, as they shared the same code base in the beginning). Font/WindowsFont for example.

Another likely candidate is in disposable wrapper classes for state such as layout. If they aren't stashed or passed around, they can be turned into structs safely.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cut back allocations on blank form startup" (#1388)
